segments.text: It makes me a bit sad seeing this unfolding.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is so absorbed in her routine, drying that plate gently.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But the sink is overflowing, and she doesn't even know.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Water pooling around her, it's like a quiet tragedy building.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are being sneaky with the cookies, full of innocent mischief.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy on the stool looks so determined, but it's risky.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I worry he'll fall and get hurt in that wet spot.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl waiting patiently tugs at my heart.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: They're just kids wanting a treat, but no one's watching.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cabinets will be damaged, and the floor too.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Outside, the garden is serene, highlighting the indoor neglect.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It reminds me of how easily things can go wrong at home.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope it ends without anyone getting upset.
segments.speaker: PAR
